Reviews.Title: My thoughts after 2 weeks..
Reviews.Author: MOOD
Reviews.Content: With prices for LCD TV's falling rapidly, i decided it was time toreplace my 5 year old 20" Sharp EDTV and step up to HD. A side by sidecomparison made it clear that i had made the right decision. The LG'spicture quality is superior in almost every way.Pro's------There aren't many quality 26" tv's out there and the 26LV2500 is one ofthe better ones i've seen so far.-The picture is vibrant and sharp and comparable to some mid-range32" non led-backlit lcd's i looked at in store. Response time looksgood to my eyes.-Most 26" tv's include 2 hdmi ports, the LG has 3.-The LG is attractive with its glass-like bezel.Thin and bright, thanks tothe LED backlight.-The Intelligent Sensor works rather well and is surprisinglyuseful.-Menu system very well laid out with useful functionality.Con's------Off angle viewing is pretty bad. Colors wash out slightly when i stand upand noticeably when moving to the sides of the screen. My old Sharp LCD wasactually a lot better in this regard.-The Sharp used a matte screen, the LG has a glossy screen and in a brightroom the image is mirror-like, particularly in dark scenes. Very annoying.-Audio quality is as bad as expected and comparable to other TV's thissmall and thin. Turning the bass all the way up and the treble nearly allthe way down makes things bearable.-Black levels and screen uniformity is as expected for a tv in this rangewith some backlight bleeding in the edges. This of course is onlynoticeable in a black screen with the backlight set to max and will notmatter under normal usage conditions.Bottom line-----------The 26LV2500 is a feature packed and thoughtfully designed LED back-lit TV.If you're in the market for a 26" TV, you can't go wrong with the LG andyou will not be disappointed as long as you take it's limitations intoconsideration.However, if you have space for a larger 32" TV, there is a wider selectionworth looking at here. With the LG, you are paying more for the LEDbacklight and thinner bezel rather than picture quality. At around $350,you can easily get a 32" 720p NON-LED LCD that is either as good or betterthan the LG.

Reviews.Title: Nice small TV
Reviews.Author: KJHarris
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small LCD TV for our guest bedroom and decided on the LG 26LV2500.  This seemed to offer the most features at the lowest price for the use it would get--only when we had guests in our spare bedroom.  The set arrived very promptly in the mfg. original packaging and there was no damage to the carton and everything was there.  It was easy to assemble and set up.  Since I was using a basic cable connection(no box) I needed only the coax connection.  The set scanned for and found all my cable provider's digital channels, both HD and SD(There are no more analog transmisions in my area). The picture is bright and clear(at least when viewed from bed) and although "only" 720p it looks as good(to me)as the two large 1080p sets that I already have.  The sound is certainly fine for the use it will get. All the settings are easy to access and adjust and there are many more inputs than I will need on this set.  I did resurrect an very old(non blueray) DVD player and connected it using the composite input--it produced a nice picture with standard DVD's.  The only thing I found a bit strange was the power brick. Instead of the set getting power directly from from a 120V outlet, you plug a power brick into the outlet, which has a cord that plugs into the TV.  I assume this is used because it is cheaper and/or easier that trying to design a 120V to 24V power supply that will fit into this very thin TV.  So overall I am pleased.

Reviews.Title: absolutely stunning picture.
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: I am, by no means a huge HD fanatic, and I don't get anal about black levels or minor flaws (really how could you at this price;) but I know when something is pleasing to my eyes and this TV is it, to say the least. Playing the PS3 or watching Breaking Bad is an experience words cannot describe, but I'll give it a shot. black levels are deep, colors are vivid (really vivid,) you can have it as bright ass you want without the strain on your eyes, and all for less than $400. Sound quality from the unit is extremely poor I have to admit (staticy bass just one example,)  but the tv is as thick as a penny (not a figure of speech.) just get some computer speakers with a sub-woofer, you'll be fine. I have only used the HDMI and USB ports so I can't touch on RCA input quality. no real complaints except for an somewhat noticeable dead pixel or something in the top right hand corner of the screen ( It is only noticed on a pure white screen, I could care less.)

Reviews.Title: LG 26V2500 - a very good TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: Paul M. Whitacre
Reviews.Content: After a few days of research, I purchased the LG 26V2500 for my home office to replace a TV system cobbled together to make due over the last few years.  I got my money's worth from the Hauppauge WinTV 950Q  tuner and had been using an old 17" LCD monitor for the TV display with a travel speaker bar for audio, all attached to my 64-bit Dell computer on Windows 7.  It worked good enough but was a hog on processing speed even with a quad core processor.I also considered the Samsung LN26D450, another highly rated LCD TV.  However, the LG had two features not offered on Samsung's TV - a coaxial input connection with an integrated ATSC/NTSC/Clear QAM digital tuner (in addition to an analog NTSC tuner).  This will allow me to receive over air DTV signals now and perhaps use the TV for digital cable sometime in the future, should the occasion arise.  The LG has backlighting LED not found in the Samsung, which I do like ( I have a larger Samsung that also has backlighting).  Both TVs were 720p resolution - 1080p isn't worth the extra cost at this screen size. The cnet.com site doesn't recommend LED as a desirable feature but I do like it.  As the LG had a lower price, it sealed the deal for me.Ordering was quick and the shipment arrived three days later with no issues.  I was surprised the TV was shipped in only its original retail packaging.  Some tape was showing the wear and tear from shipment with some separation from the box packaging.  I'd recommend Amazon reinforce the tape if this is a standard practice.  Nothing was broken or missing - no harm, no foul.  Assembly was quick - four small screws were provided to install the two-piece base to the TV body and then it was ready for hookup.I connected two HDMI cables - one for the satellite TV feed and a second for the computer - and the indoor on-air antenna.  The power is provided via a transformer adapter with a small connector in the back of the TV.  Upon powering up, a few steps brought one to the auto-detection of what is connected and then the discovery of available on-air channels.  The process was relatively quick, with the TV detecting several channels the Hauppauge tuner never found.  After using the manual channel setup, I deleted a number of channels I didn't want.I then walked through the menu to see what else was necessary.  I used the "Picture Wizard" to set up the contrast, brightness, and backlighting using some recommended on-screen guidelines, which did help identify settings I might not have otherwise considered.  I like the backlighting An energy saver feature allows the TV to reduce power consumption by lowering the backlighting levels - this I left off, using the automatically saved "Picture Wizard" settings I just input.  The ambient lighting sensor works well for changing room lighting conditions, so I don't have to fiddle with the display for daytime versus evening viewing.The audio settings were next.  I know many people in this forum complain about the audio quality from the small speakers (the price one pays for a thin LED TV) but I found the speakers more than adequate with no tinny or overly thin sound.  I've cranked the volume from 0 to 100 and noticed no significant distortion and plenty of volume. I don't listen to my music on the TV; I have a stereo system for that.  I'm no strict audiophile but I have no issue with the sound quality from any source so far.  The audio does have a feature called "Clear Voice II" that enhances speaking voices over background noise - this works well.  When they arrive, I'll hook up my small surround speakers to the TV - that will improve what is already an acceptable issue for me.I tested the display and audio from the PC and all works well.  The 1380x768 resolution is not as detailed as my other monitors but it is sufficient and the screen is larger, so having this option for streaming video and movies will be great.  Satellite and on-air DTV audio and video worked well and without issue.  The displays are clear without any discernible blurring in sports broadcasts.The remote is intuitive and doesn't have too many buttons to cause confusion.  The printed manual provides no information on the Simplink button - but a quick check on the Internet confirmed that this is for other LG components that can be interconnected to the TV.  As I have none, I leave this off in the menu selection. This omission is not a deal breaker but LG seems to have missed an opportunity to explain it and promote it in their literature.The bottom line is that, overall, I'm very happy thus far with the purchase and don't see anything that I would like modified.  I'll update this review later if the situation warrants as it is based on only a few days of use but, so far, life is indeed good with this LG product.

Reviews.Title: Best small LED TV for sound and picture
Reviews.Author: V. M. Zayas "PanFictionReader"
Reviews.Content: I almost didn't buy this TV because there were so many negative comments about the fall off in picture quality related to viewing angle. I bought this TV to replace a Samsung 22 inch LCD TV, mounted in the kitchen that I watch while I cook. The 2 x 3 Watt speakers in the Samsung were pitiful. With the sound turned up to the max, I couldn't here the sound when the dishwasher, hood fan and oven fan were on. The 2 x 5 Watt speakers in the LG 26LV2500 were the attraction (Samsung doesn't have these). To make a long story short, the fall off in viewing angle was better than in the Samsung and the sound was fabulous. Remember, this is a tiny TV with tiny speakers.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, poor product information
Reviews.Author: JNo "JNo"
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV for a bedroom or a small to medium sized room.  The picture is excellent.  Great viewing angles for an LED, and the response time is far better than my Vizio.  Something not yet mentioned in the other reviews is the quality of the user interface.  In my opinion, LG has a leg up on its competitors in this particular area.  The menus are very well designed and user-friendly.  In design sense, they are the Apple of the TV industry.  The only issue I had with this set was the product info for the type of VESA mount it requires.  The Amazon product info didn't include this and the product website had the wrong information.  For those who need to know, the VESA mounting size is 100 x 100.  Please note that a universal mount, or any with a mounting plate larger than this size, will not fit this TV.  The larger mounting plate will cover or interfere with some of the TV inputs, rendering them useless.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV
Reviews.Author: FRANK57
Reviews.Content: I almost got the "Samsung UN26D4003 26-Inches 720p 60Hz LED HDTV" and what a relief I did not.  I actually went to a local Best Buy to compare these 2 side by side. The problem with the Samsung as noted by other reviews is:  lack of ports and the fact that there is no Audio output.  The deal breaker for me was the horrible tin like sound from the Samsung, disapointing since the picture quality is good. The LG has a much better sound and more outputs.  Set up was easy and fast, and I have my dvd with HDMI set up.In terms of price, the LG is only $ 10 more.  In terms of value, you get more bang for the buck with the LG.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Artur Amirkhanyan
Reviews.Content: I love this TVit is for small room 6'x7' (small but advanced hair salon) so size is great but if you need it for a big or average size bedroom I would recommend 32" at least and 1080p would be beneficial too especially if you want to connect PC to it.CON Energy saving mode Auto-dimes the screen so terribly it is impossible to watch and there are not much options to regulate it so I just turned of energy saving mode and use it constantly on 70% brightnessPRONUSB is so great I use USB all the time for watching movies, slide show, and music play  I was surprised to find out that It can play music and make a slide show from USB simultaneously so it serves my hair salon very wellit is very light so it will be easy to install on the wallOTHERsome people mentioned bad viewing angle but they were wrong. Viewing angle is great.

Reviews.Title: LG 26LV2500
Reviews.Author: Steve "Steve"
Reviews.Content: Nice TV. One of the screws on the mounting bracket would not bite, but seems secure with only one screw.  It is fairly light weight.Glossy plastic sides will reflect ambient light .. a bit annoying.Volume is ok for a small room, but could be better.Great picture.Overall, this is my first LG appliance and I am very impressed.

Reviews.Title: Great for what it is
Reviews.Author: Chris Tefft
Reviews.Content: This LED TV  is a great choice in it's price range.  Unfortunately the first unit I received had a 4" section of dead screen right out of the box. It is incredibly slim for wall hanging.  It will mount to 1/2" drywall directly with the right wall fastener as it weighs only 20lbs.  When flush wall mounting you are not able to connect anything except one side mounted HDMI cable.  All the other connections are oriented directly out the back of the unit.  Picture is very good with several presets and a couple custom settings.  Audio is what you would expect from an ultra slim LED TV, acceptable at best.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture and Sound
Reviews.Author: Tom D
Reviews.Content: First the picture is beautiful, beyond that I'll limit this to the critique's in other reviews.  I can't find a problem viewing at different angles, no difference I can see 30 degrees either side of center and that's beyond normal in our house. You can actually see the picture, the colors and brightness at much larger angles, but the image is foreshortened as you'd expect.  LCD's have a much more severe problem and have compensation to deal especially with different vertical viewing angles.  Second issue is sound.  This LG replaced a Toshiba LCD that had serious sound quality and volume problems.  The sound is clear, "normal" and the volume range is more than adequate.  If you want to plug in your Bose speakers there are ports.The family here was happy enough with this 32" model that we bought a larger LG for another room.My only odd observation is that both LG's required two tries at automatic programming the channels to get them all.  There isn't much a user can do wrong and on the second pass they were all correct and no channels captured that were not there.  I have brand X in my office and it requires manual editing to delete about 30 false channels that it picks up in the automatic programming. It's a tedious process that takes about half an hour.Setup was easy, though you'll need a Phillips screwdriver to install the stand.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: Chritian25
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv last week so i havent seen all the tv has to offer yet but so far it has been great!!! Nice and perfect image, very light and thin and many ports to connect whatever you want! Although i would have expected more of the sound but since the tv is for my bedroom i think is perfectly more than enough! Totally recommend this tv

Reviews.Title: Did not meet my expectations
Reviews.Author: rasmusbraun
Reviews.Content: This TV has a very poor viewing angle. It starts to wash out the moment you're slightly off-center. Picture quality was sub-par, everything looked over-saturated or somewhat hazy. The down-firing speakers produced muffled sound that wasn't very loud even when turned up to the maximum level. There's a slight time delay from when you press a button on the remote control and the TV responds. It's just enough to be annoying because you're not sure if the TV received the command. And the bracket that attaches the TV to the pedestal is flimsy and poorly threaded.

Reviews.Title: LG 26" HDTV
Reviews.Author: Thomas R. Heldreth
Reviews.Content: I love this TV.  I have a boat where the strength of an antenna signal is limited.  The tuner on this TV gets a perfect picture on every available channel without digital drop.  I have a Dynex also onboard that gets a blue screen on half of the available channels using the same antenna.  Brand name does make a difference.  The color is great and the sound is good.  The menu's give you every adjustment you could want.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: Great LG
Reviews.Author: O. Hilderson
Reviews.Content: I wanted a TV strictly for watching TV programs over the air and connecting a DVD/VCR recorder/player. The picture is great. The maximum volume could be somewhat higher for an old man. Features surpassed a 40" LCD Samsung I bought a year earlier. LG has come a long way in my opinion. And last but not least, Amazon has given always great service. Five stars too.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV!
Reviews.Author: Jks586
Reviews.Content: We purchased this tv to use in our living room and we absolutely love it! It has great picture quality from every angle. The pictures are very sharp and size is perfect! The reason why we gave this item 4 stars is only due to the sound quality. Without additional speakers, it was very quiet. However, with the use of an additional speaker and subwoofer, we couldn't be more pleased with this TV. It is easy to use and easy to hook up game systems and DVD players! This T.V is great purchase for the quality and price! Amazon does a great job shipping and packaging the item so avoid damage!

Reviews.Title: Good Bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: Blackie "PAB"
Reviews.Content: An excellent TV for the bedroom. The unit is stylish, easy to use and performs well. I would have given 5 stars if the screen were able to tilt to optimize the viewing angle. Overall, very happy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for size and price, nice picture quality and energy use choices
Reviews.Author: L. Miller
Reviews.Content: I bought this from Wal-mart online for $326 a few months ago, when my 30 year old RCA 27 inch screen died.  I use the digital converter (cable tv doesn't offer much of what I want and the 4 or 5 free stations I get include local channels and PBS programs I like).  Since the advent of digital tv, I have lost more and more 'free access' channels, so I seriously considered going without a tv altogether. Scuttlebutt is sometime in 2012 there will be no more viable free access tv programming.  I figured I would have a nice new tv on which to watch videos, if that is true.Why I chose LG: I travel for business and have seen a marked difference in picture quality in the LG tvs provided in some hotels.  This unit didt disappoint.  My living room is rather dark, and I especially appreciate the choices in brihtness and energy consumption.  The menu is fairly intuitive and easy to use.  The oddest glitch is the 'stand.'  Its parts are cheap plastic, which crumbled when I tried to put them together.  So the screen is propped up against my TV cart on the floor.  Too bad this technically terrific TV is so cheesy in the physical setup.  I had to laugh when I looked this up to recommend to a friend, though.  Amazon promises it will ship in 1-2 months for $319?  I got this in a few days, free shipping to my door.  Where are they going for theirs?  Slow boat to and from China?

Reviews.Title: Good for TV not so Hot for a Monitor.
Reviews.Author: I8UNtheV
Reviews.Content: I had purchased this LG wanting to use it mainly for a monitor then a TV in the down time. I figured 720p wouldn't make that much different on only a 26" screen. I really don't care for the screen resolution running HDMI from my laptop.As a TV it works great and looks good too. So my final thoughts are that If you are primarily using it for a TV (Like Most) than you should be satisfied with this product I do however get the feel like it isn't built the best. I think this will end up in the guest bedroom and I will find a 1080p for the office.

Reviews.Title: Good value, nice size for a kitchen
Reviews.Author: Bud
Reviews.Content: This 32" LG worked fine right out of the box.  Did have a problem with the wall mounting screws - the thread wasn't quite right so you may have to purchase the right ones when wall mounting.  Pic was fine, good color, etc.  Only one issue with off-center viewing.  After about 45 deg to one side or the other, the colors start to fade & intensity diminishes.  You could say it looks washed out.  But for our application we are mostly looking straight on in the kitchen, so it's fine.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: ChrisMac12
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with the purchase of the LG tv.  I'm currently looking for an upgrade, and i will likely go with a larger model of an LG.The picture is crisp, sound is decent when not hooked to surround.  Never had any issues with the picture, inputs, or remote problems.I will buy LG again

Reviews.Title: tv
Reviews.Author: richard velazquez
Reviews.Content: excellent product important to the family would buy again if needed, durable and recommend it to everyone is required to have

Reviews.Title: Like New
Reviews.Author: shortie1982a
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas present and it came like brand new with all the original packaging, my only complaint is that the remote didnt have the batteries I know it comes with brand new. This would have been nice to know so I could be ready Christmas day with batteries.

Reviews.Title: Many channels re-re-re-repeat sound and video
Reviews.Author: Badges? ... (see Blazing Saddles)
Reviews.Content: and none of the zoom/aspect-ratio settings are *quite* right.[More "words required"? Are you mad? 5 4 3 2 1]

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the bedroom
Reviews.Author: MN
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with the TV.  It was easy to install; the picture and sound are fine.  I've had no problems with this at all.  Would buy another one, when the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: nice lcd tv
Reviews.Author: Aston
Reviews.Content: great build quality from this tv. I understand now why koreans have overtaken the japanese on electronics. excellent picture quality. Remote control is sturdy and feels well built

Reviews.Title: nice tv
Reviews.Author: LuisO
Reviews.Content: It's a Nice TV. Great picture.  A lot of functions, inputs and connectivity.  Only the sound ,  a little low.

Reviews.Title: Best in class 22" HDTV
Reviews.Author: SLS
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my blind brother knowing that it would be a challenge for him to learn the remote controls and be able to utilize it to switch between component VCR and DVD player.  I was pleasantly surprised with the easy installation and setup.  Scanning for channels was effortless.  Even without talking menus, he can easily navigate the remote and switch between TV, VCR and DVD.  The sound is good and the picture quality excellent.  There are many other excellent features he won't be able to take advantage of--that makes this LG TV best in class.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good for the price.
Reviews.Author: ElmoTheCat
Reviews.Content: Finally after several - or many - onscreen adjustments, my new 26LV2500 26" LED-LCD HDTV is looking super sharp, and sounding ok, but lacking depth. The sound will never be great because it is, after all, a flat-screen TV with not much room in the chassis for speakers. Bring your own, or do for now and locate the audio setting for Clear Voice 2 and tweak the various bars. I'll be looking for speakers next.I found it was best to use the Advanced/Enhanced settings than the quick menu settings. Note: It's pointless trying to perfect skin coloring and complexions based on personalities in stage make-up, they never look natural... The USB outlets, 3rd HDMI, and headphone jack outlets are on the left edge, easily missed, not mentioned because the manual is covers ALL their LV####TV sets leaving one to fend for oneself to fiddle with the settings. I would rate the 26LV2500 26" LED-LCD HDTV 5 stars, minus 1 star for the less than useful owner's manual. For the price I paid, all is well. At the end of the day, it was well worth the effort, so 5 stars for the result.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV with an excellent picture!
Reviews.Author: V in SC
Reviews.Content: This TV has the best picture I've ever seen. It's crystal clear. The only thing I would change is the power cord. It has the power cord like a laptop has, where you must connect the power cord together with the big boxy part sitting behind the TV. Would have been nicer with a regular power cord. Not sure why that was done on this TV. However, I'd like to purchase one of these TV's for each of my bedrooms.

Reviews.Title: nice tv, but not best for wall mounting
Reviews.Author: Maurice R. Berry Jr
Reviews.Content: Power supply is a bulky transformer that makes it difficult to mount flush against the wall.  Otherwise, great picture and nice TV.  Sound not great but typical of small set.

Reviews.Title: excellent tv good price
Reviews.Author: Gladys H. Borjas "superpekas"
Reviews.Content: a good price a excellent TV...i'm happy with this purchase great ñook and good quality image o display my next purchase will be the 42"...

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: SJM
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect choice in LED flat screens!This was purchased to be used in my kitchen area.I mounted it on an articulating wall mount above the refrigerator,which is usually dead space.Super picture,quality, and overall performance!! This makes my third LG Flat screenSteveM

Reviews.Title: Good TV, but not a Samsung
Reviews.Author: Veeral
Reviews.Content: The TV certainly looks very sleek. It has a very nice "piano" finish, and is extremely thin.  The base is also quite small, so it takes minimal space from your table top.  As nice as it is, however, it's image quality is not Samsung.  You have to make extensive adjustments to the picture, by adjusting contrast/brightness/sharpness/this that and another.  The Samsung was sharp and ready to go right out of the box. I am mostly going to use this TV set as a large monitor for my computer, and I'm quite upset.  To use for computer, I highly recommend using a VGA cable instead of HDMI, as it will allow you to use in the standard aspect ratio of the TV.  VGA will also give you near the same quality as HDMI, so you won't have to compromise quality either.

Reviews.Title: Nice Addition to my Bedroom
Reviews.Author: Rafael Gabriel Sarmiento
Reviews.Content: This TV is a great buy for its price.  It has a stylish look and good features.  This is the second LG hdtv I've purchased in the last two years.  Can say I'm sticking up to this brand.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: LK
Reviews.Content: Really, really like this TV.. it's got a good picture and is very sleak.  The only thing I wish LG had done was make a remote that lights up at night when I'm trying to watch tv with the lights off.  Otherwise, I really like it.

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed
Reviews.Author: Val
Reviews.Content: After using this TV for almost 2 months it's exactly what I needed. I use this for my video games systems (xbox360/ps3). Even though it's 720p, at the size of 32 inches it is not noticeable, I'd rather save 200 dollars then not see a difference. 32 inches is the perfect size for my room, looks and sounds great.

Reviews.Title: LG 22LV2500
Reviews.Author: oldalba
Reviews.Content: Got this TV two months ago to replace the old analog with converter box in the bedroom.  Screwed in the antenna cable, plugged in the DVD player and turned it on.  Worked flawlessly.  I like the fact that the power converter is external on this TV.  The power cord is about the same as the charger for my cell phone.  This is fantastic for a wall-mount situation where cords and cables can be a real eye sore.  Good idea LG.  One last comment.....to attach the base to the TV, put the TV onto the base. (Like it SAYS in the instructions) Then install the screws.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a great little TV.  I needed a replacement TV for my bedroom and stumbled upon this one.  I have a larger LG in my living room that have been extremely pleased with, so when I saw that they had a smaller version I had to go for it.The picture is great, even without HD service.  The menu is easy to use.  Literally plug in and you're all set.The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is b/c the sound seems to be slightly distorted on a few channels.  It isn't horrible, but enough to notice.All in all, I would highly recommend for occasional use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Quality
Reviews.Author: TLeon
Reviews.Content: Beyond my best expectation and it is the best in all areas..sound..picture..easy to program to your needs..it looks bigger than it really is..I have never been disappointed in Amazon....

Reviews.Title: Think mine is defective...being returned
Reviews.Author: Denver Consumer "bluetinkerbell"
Reviews.Content: The set received today is defective.  Picture is initially bright and clear, but rapidly dims and no setting tried maintains the brightness and clarity.  The call to LG proved to be a bad experience.  The rep kept putting me through the same steps (having to do with energy saving and pressing 2 keys on the remote).  Each time I did as instructed, the screen was almost immediately turned off and the rep would not listen to what I was trying to tell him.  If the main problem is due to the energy saver feature (as the rep kept insisting), there are other problems as well.  Ultimately, the rep became argumentative and told me I'd just have to keep pressing the buttons until I got it right (there were 2 keys to press).  I grew annoyed with his talking to me like I was dimwitted and told him I did not want to continue the conversation. He just got louder and I had to get rude with him and turned my phone off...he immediately called me back and I told him not to call me again...he called again and I told him if he continued calling me, I would lodge a complaint against him...this ended the calls.I have another LG TV (the 32") and love it, which is why I bought the 22" for my computer room.  Right now, I will probably go back to my 15" Sharp VERY OLD TV.There would be no negative feedback and I would simply exchange the TV but for the attitude of the customer rep.  So this is more about the customer service at LG. LG 22LV2500 22-Inch 720p 60Hz LED-LCD HDTV

Reviews.Title: LG 26in LED TV
Reviews.Author: Richard H. Baker
Reviews.Content: The LG 26lv2500 is a perfect choice for my bedroom.  The only thing that could have improved it is Netflix access.

Reviews.Title: Very good small TV, but one drawback...
Reviews.Author: makeup maven
Reviews.Content: I needed a 22"-24" tv and researched tons of them. I bought the Samsung 22" inch 5003 after reading a lot of reviews but the colors it produced were intolerable so I need to return it. The LG has almost everything I want, decent sound, good picture and reliable color. But compared the samsung 5000/5003 and my former samsung ln19a65o there is a TON of picture noise on this TV. Ugh. And from what i've read this is because it's native resolution is 768x1366 and so it needs to be scaled and as a result the pixels don't match your tv's pixels exactly. Okay, that sounds a lot worse than it actually is, but it's obvious when looking at the tv. After going from my original samsung, and then the samsung 5003 it is so evident and almost unbearable but if you are *NOT* coming from a samsung or other non-scaling HD tv you may not notice it and it may even look good to you. If you're replacing a samsung, i'd be willing to bet the picture noise on this TV will bother you. it's actually bugging the HECK out of me, but i really haven't had any luck finding a TV without a drawback equal to it. Check the LG out in person if you can before purchasing.If you're not real fussy about realistic color, skip this and get one of the current flat panel sammy 22" line up instead of the LG, but check both the Sammy and the LG side by side in Best Buy if you can and see which issue bothers you less.Other than that issue, this is a good tv. Other than the picture noise the images are clear. I fiddled with the sound settings a bit and the sound can be...okay, you're not going to find small lcd/led tvs that can produce sound much better than just okay.The blacks could be a little better, if you watch a fair amount of dark movies this might bother you. I use my TV mostly for a few prime time TV shows and occasional action moves so it's not too much of an issue although noticeable and slightly annoying.as for the little things, the different picture pre-sets are pretty good, and the built-in picture customization tool is pretty cool and helpful i guess, but i have the Disney WOW dvd for that. The Inteli-sensor setting is actually kinda good, automattically adjusting the picture to whatever lighting there is in the room at the time.The number and type of outputs are great, they have everything a person might need, 2 hdmi, audio out, pc links, etc, and I love the onscreen menu, i think it's great.So basically, everything about the TV is good, the picture noise is pretty much the only flaw, but i'll try to live it.

Reviews.Title: Poor Manual
Reviews.Author: visionfounder
Reviews.Content: Ordered it Sunday and received it Wed., prompt shipping by Abt Electronics through Amazon. The picture appears to be at least OK with SD Cable and Blu-Ray Disc. I will be using headphones so I did not pay much attention to the sound. However, I will probably never buy another LG product due to the manual. The manual appears to be for every TV that LG sells, takes considerable time just to find info that relates to my TV. This applies to both the printed one and the HTML based manual.

Reviews.Title: Well...too bad!
Reviews.Author: bookworm
Reviews.Content: I'm not an audiophile and just use this as a small second television, so the warnings about poor sound quality didn't deter me. Wrong! I've adjusted the customized options and still end up with such poor sound that it annoys even me.I also find the "self adjusting" picture intensity is problematical.  I'm still playing with the custom settings in an attempt to fix that.Strangely, in addition to the usual manual, the television comes with a CD to explain how to use it.  (Perhaps that indicates these problems are enough to warrant detailed explanations?)  I haven't yet delved into the video -- I'll do so as I've given up trying adjustments on my own!This was my first experience buying a television without seeing it first.  I won't make that mistake again.

Reviews.Title: The BEST Television
Reviews.Author: E. ALEXANDER
Reviews.Content: I recently viewed a LG monitor in my eye doctor's office and he explained it was the best.  He showed me the difference in clarity, color and brightness compared to another monitor in his office.  Within a week I was having dinner at a friend's home who had a 42in LG television.  I could see so well that I didn't put on my glasses to see the images.  So, the next week I purchased my own LG television.  I LOVE this television.  The picture is great and without having to use HD I feel I have great clarity, color and brightness.  I'll never buy another brand.

Reviews.Title: Lousy sound
Reviews.Author: relict
Reviews.Content: The sound quality is so poor that I have to buy additional speakers even though I am not a "surround sound" fancier. More plugs and wires!!!The written setup directions are minimal but a dvd is included. Unfortuately my desktop is in another room so running back and forth is frustrating. Had to call my cable company to get the LG remote code for their equipment to work properly. The picture is fine but a little dark.

Reviews.Title: AG
Reviews.Author: AG
Reviews.Content: THis is nice LED in this price. I ordered this 2 months back and enjoying it lot.Though now i am bit shocked when seen price reduced even $70 more than my purchase price.It is very slim, work good when i connect USB or HDMI cable.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture
Reviews.Author: barb1048
Reviews.Content: Television arrived right on time and was easy to install. The picture is great and it has very adequate inputs for Blue Ray etc.

Reviews.Title: Solid, affordable LED
Reviews.Author: CT
Reviews.Content: Picked up this TV for $378 at Walmart. Already have an LG 46LD550 and fell in love with it so I went with LG again and was very satisfied once more. Picture quality is very good, tons of colors and accurate blacks. TV is super light and thin, easy to move with swivel stand or mount (sold separately). No real bells or whistles but great bedroom TV. LED backlighting uses a staggeringly low amount of energy -- sticker on the TV said that if it's used for five hours a day, it'll only cost $8 per year. Viewing angle isn't as good as some other sets but not a deal-breaker. Speakers are down-firing and get the job done, not particularly well but done nonetheless. Swivel stand is a little flimsy (same thing for my 46") but is a nice feature as long as its out of reach for children or large, wild dogs. Would recommend or buy again, especially at the Walmart price.

Reviews.Title: Good product. Does not work properly in other countries!
Reviews.Author: Felipe O Santos
Reviews.Content: Great TV set; good price.However I purchased this TV to give it as a gift for a family member in Brazil. For some reason, it does not work properly there. No color!!!

Reviews.Title: Extremely Pleased - Holiday Baking Saved
Reviews.Author: Que2you "Southern Girl"
Reviews.Content: I really wanted a combo TV/DVD player for the kitchen.  Ordered the LG TV after returning a 19" Toshiba combo TV purchased from AFES because of a scratch on the screen.  Wanted a TV for the kitchen to keep me entertained while doing holiday baking; figured a combo would be best to save space.  Had a hard time finding a 22"-24" quality combo.  Frantically ordered this LG TV and the Sony DVP-SR500H in hopes it would arrive in time.  Through the magic of Prime they both arrived within the week.  (Thank you Amazon)  I am so pleased with these two purchases!  I didn't want to spend the extra money on a Blue-Ray just for the kitchen. Pleased to say, with the up-scaling DVD player Blue-Ray is not missed.  This combination even made the "King of Persia" look good! LOL

Reviews.Title: LG 32 Inch tv
Reviews.Author: Uncle Ted "TM"
Reviews.Content: If you are going to buy a tv might as well get the latest technogoly and go with LED.This tv gives a very sharp and dark background and beats Plasma and LCD by a mile.Perfect set for the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: GOOD TV
Reviews.Author: LEO EDGE JR.
Reviews.Content: THIS IS A EXCELLENT TV. GREAT PICTURE AND SOUND. IT ALSO HAS A HEADPHONE JACK WHICH SO MANY LACK. i ALSO OWN THE 26 INCH MODEL FOR USE IN A RV. IT WORKS EXTREMELY WELL ALSO.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy LG products
Reviews.Author: jimnbrandi2
Reviews.Content: Out of the box I had convinced myself that the LG 32LV2500 LED HDTV was going to be a good buy, despite having a couple of friends try and steer me away from LG products (one purchased a dishwasher, and one a refrigerator) but their experiences were with appliances and I was buying electronics.  I received the order end of November 2011 and the unit was actually made in October 2011, so I was happy to not get something that had been sitting in a warehouse for 4-6 months.  Since it was a Christmas present it did stay in the box till Christmas Day 2011.  The television seemed to work flawlessly despite less than impressive HD quality and poor view from anywhere other than directly in front of the TV.  Then on January 20, 2012 the TV would not turn on.  I called for assistance and went through several steps with the LG tech support, trying different outlets, etc. nothing worked.  They said they would set up a service call with an authorized repair center and that a repairman would come by on Friday January 27, 2012.  Well nobody came to my house on Friday, nobody called with an explaination, so I called LG customer service back.  I am not sure what country LG customer service is located in but they were very hard to understand.  LG explained that I needed to call and set up the repair with the authorized repair facility, he gave me the name and number of the nearest repair center more than 40 miles away.  When I contact the authorized repair facility he tells me that LG had informed him of the warranty repair the week prior and that he had all of my information.  At this point I think that the problem is with the authorized repair center just not keeping the appointment so I asked, "Well since you did'nt make it by on Friday, when will you be here to repair my TV?  The owner of the small electronics store informed me that he had contacted LG after receiving the repair notice to let them know that since LG does not pay for mileage or trip charges and that unless I could bring the TV in to his business I would have to wait until he had another call or two in my location so he could justify the 80-mile round trip.  So now I am making the 80-mile round trip on my dime and time, LG should have let me know that the repairman had called them back and informed them of this instead of me sitting around all day Friday waiting for someone who was never going to show up in the first place.  LG has proven that their customer service is inept, and that everything they make is of poor quality.  I will tell my friends I should have listened to them and that their experiences with LG appliances were a good indication of LG products in general.  Stay away from anything made by LG.

Reviews.Title: Life is Good
Reviews.Author: Donna Dunaway
Reviews.Content: Our LG 22-inch television arrived quickly.  The set up was quick and easy.  Picture and sound are excellent. We are very pleased.

Reviews.Title: 22" LG tv
Reviews.Author: JumpStart845
Reviews.Content: For use in bedroom, seems the perfect size.  Color and brilliance are good.  My first hdtv, enjoying the quality of the picture.

Reviews.Title: LED TV
Reviews.Author: Ronald Miller
Reviews.Content: Great Picture. The picture is very sharp and bright. It is very thin and nice looking. Hopefully its quality is as good as it looks.

Reviews.Title: LG 22LV2500 22-Inch 720p 60 Hz LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: B. Burch
Reviews.Content: Ok, not great. I have several other LG sets and they do a much better job. Hasn't been in operation very log so I can'y make a accurate judgement. One big selling point with LG for me is a factory authorized service center is only 10 miles away.
